Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that Amish communities are completely unaffected by COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on misconceptions and altered images.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Amish communities are immune to COVID-19 because they don't own televisions, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides alternative explanations by mentioning CDC studies and news reports that show COVID-19 has affected Amish communities.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that COVID-19 has affected Amish communities like any other population in America.
Understate: The claim understates the impact of COVID-19 on Amish communities by suggesting they are unaffected.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by spreading misconceptions and using altered images to support its argument.
